subject: Parenting
title: Theory of Mind
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Theory of Mind.

hook.text: A three-year-old hides by covering her eyes. If she can't see you, you can't see her.

buildup.text: Theory of mind is understanding that other people have different thoughts than yours.

discovery.text: Most children develop it between ages four and five, proven by false-belief tests.

twist.text: Before this, a child genuinely believes you know everything she knows.

climax.text: Theory of mind is what makes deception, empathy, and storytelling possible.

punchline.text: Understanding others starts with knowing you're separate.

quiz.question: What is 'theory of mind'?
options: Understanding that others have different thoughts and beliefs
A scientific hypothesis about brain function
